sentence.text: The eldest affected sibling is a girl who was born following a full-term spontaneous pregnancy.
During the pregnancy, polyhydramnios was detected, but genetic tests were not performed.
Delivery was normal (vaginal), and the various birth parameters including weight, height, and head circumference were reported to be normal.
Immediately after birth, craniofacial dysmorphism was noticed.
The neurological and physical examination revealed hypotonia and poor feeding.
Because of these dysmorphic features and the hypotonia, a brain ultrasound was performed at the age of four months, revealing colpocephaly with dysgenesis of the corpus callosum.
At a later stage, the patient exhibited moderate global developmental delay with gait difficulties (she started walking at the age of four years) and pronounced language delay.
She was toilet-trained and able to dress with help at the ages of six and eight years, respectively.
Delay in primary dentition and gingival hyperplasia were also detected.
At the age of four years, the patient started experiencing recurrent generalized tonic–clonic seizures.
Each convulsion lasted for 3–5 min then ceased spontaneously.
She had one epileptic seizure per month.
The electroencephalogram (EEG) revealed epileptic discharges of rhythmic high amplitude slow waves with 5 Hz frequency over the right hemisphere with secondary generalization to both hemispheres.
Treatment with valproic acid reduced the frequency of seizures; however, the seizures recurred upon cessation of treatment seizures.
She received speech therapy, physiotherapy, and occupational therapy.
Furthermore, the girl had moderate intellectual disabilities and attended a special education class.
Her chest X-ray report indicated the presence of bilateral bifid and fused ribs, as well as hemivertebrae for the first and second thoracic vertebrae (T1 and T2).
Behavioral difficulties were reported, including anxiety and emotional instability with impulsive behaviors.

At her last examination at age 22 yr, she was 195 cm tall, and her head circumference was 56 cm (>98th percentile and 75th percentile, respectively) with brachycephaly, a narrow forehead, a flat face with highly arched bushy eyebrows, long eyelashes, frontal bossing, hypertelorism, epicanthal folds, synophrys, upslanting palpebral fissures, micrognathia, wide nasal bridge and low-set ears, chest asymmetry, pes planus and clinodactyly, and normal sexual development.
Her brain MRI showed corpus callosum agenesis.
Cardiac echocardiogram and the metabolic studies were found to be normal.
Peripheral blood karyotype analysis was 46, XX.
